courses.description: An introduction to the current techniques and technologies for diagnosis of musculoskeletal disorders and the principles of management, with coverage over non-operative means, alternative medicine, and also principles of surgical intervention especially for arthritis and aged problems.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Geriatric Orthopaedics
courses.learning_outcomes:
The student should be able to understand and apply:
1. Current techniques and technologies for diagnosis of musculoskeletal disorders
2. The principles of management, with coverage over non-operative means and alternative medicine
3. Principles of surgical intervention especially for arthritis and aged problems.
courses.course_syllabus:
Current Diagnosis of Ortho Problems
- Radiological investigations
- Arthroscopy & Minimal invasive surgery for Joint Injuries and Soft tissue Injuries and Healing
- Biophysical interventions: vibration, LIPUS, and Shock Wave
- Bone Health Research, Extreme CT
- Principles of Physical Diagnosis of musculoskeletal problems; and Clinical Diagnostic Skills for Common MSK problems
MSK Disorders, Special conditions, Aging and Degeneration
- Sarcopenia, Osteoporosis and Aging
- Infection, Tumor and other bone diseases
- Injuries and fragility fractures
- Upper limb
- Foot and Ankle
- Arthritis
- Spine
Principles of Rehab.
- Assessment of Function & Impairment, and Assessment of Satisfaction & Outcomes
- Models of Rehabilitation for Musculoskeletal Disorders, and Community Rehabilitation
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students should complete the online CTE after final lesson.
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the references from individual speakers.

courses.subject: MRGO
courses.title: Pain Management and Psychosocial Aspects of Rehabilitation

meetings.instructor:
Mr NG Chi Chung, 
Professor CHAIR Sek Ying, 
Professor CHAU Steven Wai Ho, 
Professor LI Cheuk Yin

courses.description: Pain in particular chronic pain of the musculoskeletal system is closely linked to psychosocial consequences of disability and proper management is the key to rehabilitation. The new arrangement will provide a holistic approach, and enables participants to explore more deeply the psychosocial issues that arise from musculoskeletal impairments and disabilities and to prepare them for further studies in health counseling or behaviour therapy. In addition the causes, nature and types of musculoskeletal pain are discussed, and introduction to management including the psychosocial interventions, medications, interventional treatments and alternative treatments including Chinese medicine.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Geriatric Orthopaedics
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students should be able to understand and apply:
A. Principles of pain management
1. Mechanisms of pain and theory
2. Survey of common causes of musculoskeletal pain
3. Psychosocial aspects of pain and non-medication treatment of pain
4. Pain medication and pharmacology
5. Interdisciplinary approach

B. Psychosocial aspects of rehabilitation
1. Psychosocial issues, presentations, subjective and objective assessments
2. Post-traumatic stress disorders and related problems
3. Acute interventions
4. Psychosocial issues and management of musculoskeletal injuries (CBT)
courses.course_syllabus:
Pain Management and Assessment
- Acute and chronic musculoskeletal pain (trauma, surgery, degeneration, rheumatism, MPS, fibromyalgia) and concept of multi-modal analgesia
- LBP and Neuropathic Pain involves limbs: CRPS, PLP, peripheral neuropathies
- Non-pharmacological modalities for pain relief and rehabilitation
- The assessment of pain: grading and monitoring & Cognitive & Psychosocial Assessment
Psychosocial Aspects of Rehabilitation
- Effect of psychosocial conditions on pain perception and rehabilitation
- Psychiatric Disorders and Pain
- Cognitive Behaviour Therapy
- Role of Psychotherapy on pain management and rehabilitation
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students should complete the online CTE after final lesson.
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the references from individual speakers

courses.subject: MRGO
courses.title: Geriatric Orthopaedics â€“ Rehabilitative Management of Common Musculoskeletal Problem

meetings.instructor:
Professor NG Wai Kit Raymond, 
Professor WONG Ronald Man Yeung

Professor NG Wai Kit Raymond, 
Professor WONG Ronald Man Yeung

Professor NG Wai Kit Raymond, 
Professor WONG Ronald Man Yeung

courses.description: Introduction of geriatric in falls: medical assessment, gait disorders, comprehensive geriatric assessment, and long term care, anti-ageing and exercise, perioperative management of hip fracture patients: medical aspects, dementia and delirium, nutrition and wound, neurological conditions: stroke and parkinsonism, osteoporosis and sarcopenia and peri-discharge and post discharge planning and support. Introduction to evaluation and management of daily self care activities; quality and outcome measures of rehabilitation, rehabilitation of geriatric patients, rehabilitation of specific disorders, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Geriatric Orthopaedics
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students should be able to understand and apply:
1. Falls: medical assessment, gait disorders, comprehensive geriatric assessment, and long term care
2. Anti-ageing and exercise
3. Perioperative management of hip fracture patients: medical aspects, dementia and delirium, nutrition and wound
4. Neurological conditions: stroke and parkinsonism, osteoporosis and sarcopenia
5. Peri-discharge and post discharge planning and support
6. Daily self care activities; quality and outcome measures of rehabilitation, rehabilitation of geriatric patients, rehabilitation of specific disorders
courses.course_syllabus:
Management of bowel & bladder in geriatric orthopaedic patients
Rehabilitation of geriatric patients â€“ special considerations in patient with orthopaedic problems
Rehabilitation of osteoporosis and fragility fractures in elderly
Wheelchair, seating and assistive technology for disability reduction
Principles of prosthetic prescription and Common orthoses used in the elderly
Rehabilitation of elderly patients with spinal and spinal cord pathologies
Introduction of International Classification of Functioning, Disability and Health (ICF)
Quality and outcome measures of rehabilitation
Physical agents, manipulation, massage and traction, electrical stimulation, Exercise physiology, therapeutic exercise, and aquatic rehabilitation
Elderly Rehabilitation and Step Down unit
Sarcopenia workshop
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students should complete the online CTE after final lesson.
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the references from individual speakers.

courses.description: This course aims to provide basic knowledge of biostatistics and research methodology.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Geriatric Orthopaedics

1. Principles of evidence-based research
2. Research, academic conduct and anti-plagiarism measures
3. Principles of biostatistics
courses.course_syllabus:
Research Designs
Ethics & Critically appraising the journal articles
Systematic literature review and Meta-analysis methodology
Introduction of Data Analysis
Clinical Studies & Trial: Causation, Association & correlation

courses.description: In this course participants will have opportunity to present and discuss management of rehabilitation problems with interdisciplinary/ multidisciplinary approaches.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Geriatric Orthopaedics
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students should be able to understand and apply:
Principle of rehabilitation problems in geriatric orthopaedics and musculoskeletal rehabilitation.
courses.course_syllabus:
Each student will be assigned case(s) for preparing presentation, with class discussion afterwards.
Topics included:
- Common Shoulder Problems
- Obstetrics & Gynaecology related Musculoskeletal Disorders
- Burn & Scar Management
- Fragility Fracture: Hospital and Community Geriatric Care
- Sexual Disorders in Musculoskeletal Conditions
- Sports related Disorders and Injuries
- Amputee Rehabilitation
- Hand and Upper Limb Disorders
- Degenerated Joint Disorders
- Multiple Trauma
- Spine Problems
- Chronic Regional Pain Syndrome and Pain Management

courses.description: This course aims at developing the professional knowledge and skill of students in prescription of Exercises for Old Age populations, especially with common geriatric condition (degenerative disease, cardiopulmonary problems and other pharmacological considerations).

Understanding the Exercise Physiology
Understanding the applications of Exercises for the Old Age Populations, related also with common Geriatric problems.

Aerobic and resistance exercise for elderly people: from bench to bedside
Exercise Physiology

Exercise Prescription for Osteoporosis and Metabolic Diseases

courses.subject: MRGO
courses.title: Evidence Based Practice in Orthopaedic Geriatrics

meetings.instructor:
Professor CHAIR Sek Ying, 
Professor CHAN Yue Lai

Mr NG Chi Chung, 
Professor CHAIR Sek Ying, 
Professor CHAN Yue Lai

courses.description: This course aims at develop the professional knowledge and skill of students in providing comprehensive care for common geriatric orthopaedic conditions (degenerative disease, fracture and spinal problems) and to effectively manage the common geriatric syndromes (such as delirium, incontinence, and malnutrition) among this disease cohort. The course also develops the studentsâ€™ ability to apply evidence-based care models for fall prevention and end-of-life care promotion.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Geriatric Orthopaedics
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Discuss the health care needs and evidence-based care to manage the patients with common geriatric orthopedic conditions including degenerative disease, fracture and spinal conditions.
2. Discuss the evidence-based practice to manage the typical symptoms among geriatric orthopedic conditions.
3. Discuss the application of evidence-based care model in fall prevention among geriatric orthopedic conditions
4. Discuss the application of end-of-life care model to improve the health outcomes of patients with geriatric orthopedic condition and their families.
courses.course_syllabus:
Evidence-based care to manage degenerative orthopedic problems among older adults: osteoporosis & osteoarthritis
Evidence-based care for common spinal conditions among geriatric patients
Evidence-based care for fracture among geriatric patients
Evidence-based practice to promote wound healing among patients with geriatric orthopedic problems
Evidence-based practice to promote continence care among patients with geriatric orthopedic problem
Evidence-based practice to manage delirium among patients with geriatric orthopedics problem
Application of evidence-based end-of-life programs for geriatric orthopedic patients
Application of fall prevention programs for geriatric orthopedic problem
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students should complete the online CTE after final lesson.
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the references from individual speakers

courses.subject: MRGO
courses.title: Geriatric Care and Clinical Management of Musculoskeletal System

meetings.instructor: Professor MA Hon Ming Bosco
Professor MA Hon Ming Bosco

Mr NG Chi Chung, 
Professor MA Hon Ming Bosco

courses.description: Introduce the geriatric care of musculoskeletal system including assessment of the functional, cognitive, and affective status of older patients, and evaluating their needs for better management. Common medical diseases will also be deliberated with case studies specifically in metabolic bone and joint diseases.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Geriatric Orthopaedics
courses.course_syllabus:
Comprehensive geriatric assessment and Assessment of frailty in elderly people
Falls: medical assessment, prevention in different settings, gait disorders
Dementia and delirium
Neurological conditions: stroke and parkinsonism
Chronic musculoskeletal pain in the elderly
Perioperative management of hip fractures
Pre-discharge and post-discharge planning and support
Traditional Chinese Medicine therapy for common musculoskeletal problems of the elderly
Pharmacotherapy for musculoskeletal disorders in elderly people: from prevention to treatment and pain control
Aerobic and resistance exercise for elderly people: from bench to bedside
Nutrition in elderly patients with orthopaedic problems
Abuse, ethical and legal issues in elder care
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students should complete the online CTE after final lesson
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the references of individual speakers

courses.subject: MRGO
courses.title: Musculoskeletal Rehabilitation: Disability Management
courses.description: This is an introduction to the spectrum of musculoskeletal disorders and Rehabilitation issues related to principle of management and community rehabilitation to the physical disability; the psychosocial well-being of care providers; Impairment, disability and social standing: assessment and function; Management of specific medical and musculoskeletal problems such as chronic medical condition, musculoskeletal and cognitive impairment; Occupation assessment and the work environment; Assessment of work capacity and impairment; Medico-legal issues of Work Injuries, Return to work programmes and barriers.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Geriatric Orthopaedics
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students should be able to understand and apply:
1. Principle of management and community rehabilitation to the physical disability
2. Impairment, disability and social standing: assessment and function
3. Management of specific medical and musculoskeletal problems
4. Managing the Psychosocial Well Being of Care providers
5. Application of ergonomics: occupation assessment and work environment
6. Assessment of work capacity and impairment, and the Medico-legal issues of Work Injuries
7. Return to work programmes and barriers
courses.course_syllabus:
Musculoskeletal Rehabilitation: Disability Management in impairment, disability and social standing: assessment and function.
1. To reach the unreachable and to fill the service gap: another type of community rehabilitation service in Hong Kong
2. Environmental Modifications and Control for the Disabled.
3. A barrier-free environment that are user-friendly
4. Orthotics and prosthetics, and supportive devices
5. 3D printing for Rehabilitation
6. Sensor and Control, Robotics for Rehabilitation, including the exoskeleton and prosthetic arm
7. Managing the Psychosocial Well Being of Care Providers
8. Handling psychological problems in Geriatric patients and Work Injury
9. Physiotherapy to the people with disabilities
Occupational orthopaedics; Ergonomic & Work capacity assessment; Work Fitness & exercises; RTW & its barriers.
1. Workstation ergonomic analysis, Work Fitness & Exercises
2. Functional Capacity Evaluation, Job tasks analysis, Return to Work (RTW) programme and barriers
3. Medico-legal Issues of Work Injury in Hong Kong including compensation
Management of specific medical and musculoskeletal problems
1. Metabolism-induced orthopaedic conditions
2. Trauma induced disability and management
3. Causes, treatment and rehabilitation of second fracture
4. Foot disorders in children
5. Is my child limping? â€“ gait disorders and gait analysis in childhood
6. Spinal problems in children and their rehabilitation
7. Congenital Upper Limb Anomaly (CULA): Occurrence and Orthopaedics Management in Hong Kong. How to support the patients to go back to school or work?
8. Aging on the musculoskeletal system affecting balance, co-ordination and motor performance
9. Medical problems with aging â€“ Heart and Lung diseases, Nutrition
10. Hemiplegia
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students should complete the online CTE after final lesson.
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the references from individual speakers.

courses.subject: MRGO
courses.title: Musculoskeletal Rehabilitation: Special Problems & Management Issues

meetings.instructor:
Professor LEUNG Siu Man, 
Professor NG Wai Kit Raymond, 
Professor SHENG Bun, 
Professor TANG Ning, 
Professor WONG Ronald Man Yeung, 
Professor WONG Wing Yee

Mr NG Chi Chung, 
Professor LEUNG Siu Man, 
Professor NG Wai Kit Raymond, 
Professor SHENG Bun, 
Professor TANG Ning, 
Professor WONG Ronald Man Yeung, 
Professor WONG Wing Yee

courses.description: Assessment and rehabilitation requirements for different body regions will be covered systemically, highlighting their special requirements. This would include rehabilitation for tendon and nerve injuries in the upper extremities, rehabilitation of ligamental injuries in the lower limbs (especially related to sports injuries), and back rehabilitation. Special issues will cover rehabilitation for joint replacement, major and multiple fractures (e.g. pelvic fractures)
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Geriatric Orthopaedics
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students should be able to understand and apply:
1. Spinal problems: lower limbs arthritis, lower limb injuries, upper limb injuries and upper limb non-injury disorders
2. Nerve injury rehabilitation, major trauma, multiple trauma, overuse syndromes, ankylosing spondylitis and rheumatoid arthritis
3. Musculoskeletal infection, tumour surgery and osteoporotic fracture
4. Obstetrical and gynaecological related musculoskeletal problems
5. Burn management and plastic surgery
6. Musculoskeletal problems in growing children and elderly
courses.course_syllabus:
Management of patients with inflammatory arthritis
Issues relating with major or multiple trauma
Rehabilitation in common sport related disorder and overuse injuries
Burn management and plastic surgery
Special Issues on Spinal Disorders
Peripheral nerve injuries & peripheral nerves regenerative intervention
Neuromusculoskeletal disorder and normal physiology in a growing child
Age changes in neuromusculoskeletal system â€“ stroke, parkinsonism, and dementia;
Sarcopenia and osteoporosis
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students should complete the online CTE after final lesson.
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the references from individual speakers.

courses.description: This course aims to provide basic knowledge of Musculoskeletal Ultrasound and the application.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Geriatric Orthopaedics
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students will understand:
1. Basic principles of ultrasound
2. Basic medical imaging and interventional radiology for soft tissue disorders
3. Basic anatomy of upper limb, lower limb, and neck & spine regions
4. Other applications on musculoskeletal ultrasound:
courses.course_syllabus:
Ultrasound Machine Knobology & terminology and Choice of ultrasound machine/probes in clinical applications
Basic MSK Ultrasound Pathologies and intervention
Applications of Musculoskeletal Ultrasound of Medicine
Clinical applications of Ultrasound on MSK Conditions - POC â€“ Diagnosis, Monitoring, guide treatment, procedures
1. Anaesthesia and Pain Medicine applications
2. Orthopedic applications
3. Rheumatologist applications
Basic Sonoanatomy of:
1. Upper Limb I - Shoulder
2. Upper Limb II - Elbow, wrists (Carpal tunnel, P. Nerves)
3. Lower Limb I - Hip Joint, & Knee- Effusion, CLL, PT tendons, bursa
4. Lower Limb II â€“ Foot and Ankle, Calf, Achilles, Plantar fascia, Bunion, Neuroma
5. Trunk CORES muscles and Lumbar Spine, SI joint
6. Neck & Thoracic Spine â€“ Cervical and Thoracic Spine, Ribs, nerves root

courses.subject: MRGO
courses.title: Musculoskeletal Conference and Workshop (Occupational Rehabilitation)

meetings.instructor: Mr NG Chi Chung

courses.description:
This module enables students to participate in musculoskeletal conferences / workshops to expand their perspectives and understanding in occupation rehabilitation issues.
(Enrolment to this module will be subject to prior approval by the Programme Director)
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Geriatric Orthopaedics
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students should be able to:
Expand their perspectives and understanding in occupational rehabilitation issues by participation in musculoskeletal conferences / workshops.
courses.course_syllabus:
Students who have attended a recognized conferences/workshops in musculoskeletal medicine or rehabilitation within the period of studying our programme can apply for the recognition of qualification.
The theme of conference/workshop should be related to the theme of the module, and either be:
1. University run/affiliated course
2. HA run/affiliated course
3. College run/affiliated course
4. Musculoskeletal related
5. OrthoGeri related
6. Rehabilitation related
7. CME/CPD/CND accredited conference/workshop
8. Those outside these criteria will be considered case by case.
courses.feedback_evaluation: No Course Teaching Evaluation is required for this module.
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the references from the conferences/workshops

courses.subject: MRGO

meetings.instructor:

courses.description: Introduction of Robotic Rehabilitation for Neuroplasticity Rehabilitation and therapeutic application of exoskeleton for rehabilitation
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Geriatric Orthopaedics
courses.course_attributes:
Cantonese and English
All Face-to-Face Teaching
courses.course_syllabus:
This module consists of lectures and on-site demonstration of robotic rehabilitation, including:

1. Principles of neuroplasticity and rehabilitation;
2. Introduction of robotics technology (exoskeleton and end-effector training)
3. Demonstration of robotic rehabilitation technology
4. Case studies
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students should complete the online CTE after final lesson.
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the references from individual speakers

courses.description: This course will require students to conduct a review/project of a musculoskeletal problem in rehabilitation or geriatric orthopaedics. Students have to write up a dissertation on the literature review or project. The review or project will be done under the supervision of a faculty member.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Musculoskeletal Medicine, Rehabilitation and Geriatric Orthopaedics
courses.learning_outcomes: The students should be able to (1) conduct a research project, (2) understand the knowledge of a specific topic, and (3) submit a review or project report.
courses.course_syllabus:
The project helps the student to organize and apply the knowledge he has learnt into an in-depth study or analysis of a clinical problem or a topic of significance. The student carries out a project under supervision of a tutor, and the result is compiled into an original written report of around 5000 words (excluding tables and references), and give a satisfactorily oral presentation in a class seminar.

The type of project ranges from a prospective case cohort study, retrospective case cohort review, to an in-depth guided case study and systematic review / meta-analysis.
courses.feedback_evaluation: No Course Teaching Evaluation is required for this module.
courses.required_readings: Students should have satisfactory references to support the project development.
